verbose_text: If, on one hand, we show that oxygen shortage enables B55alpha accumulation, on the other hand, we speculate that in breast cancer cells glucose deprivation reduces the production of fumarate mainly because of a block of SDH, tilting the balance toward an excess of alpha-KG at the expense of the PHD2 inhibitor fumarate, overall resulting in enhanced PHD2 activity and increased B55alpha degradation.
evidence: glucose deprivation reduces the production of fumarate mainly because of a block of SDH              , tilting the balance toward an excess of alpha-KG
